title: Work, Power, Energy
narration: Welcome to this exploration of work power and energy three fundamental concepts in physics. Understanding these concepts is crucial for explaining how things move and interact in the world around us.

title: Work
content:
Work is done when a force causes displacement.
Work equals force times distance (W = F x d).
Measured in Joules (J).
image_desc: Person pushing a box. Type: illustration
narration: In physics work is defined as the energy transferred to or from an object by applying a force along a displacement. Simply put work is done when a force causes something to move. The amount of work done is calculated by multiplying the force applied by the distance over which the force acts and it is measured in Joules.

title: Power
content:
Power is the rate at which work is done.
Power equals work divided by time (P = W / t).
Measured in Watts (W).
narration: Power is a measure of how quickly work is being done. It tells us how much energy is transferred per unit of time. Mathematically power is calculated by dividing the amount of work done by the time it takes to do the work and its unit of measurement is the Watt.

title: Energy
content:
Energy is the ability to do work.
Kinetic energy (energy of motion).
Potential energy (stored energy).
Energy is measured in Joules (J).
image_desc: Roller coaster at the top of a hill. Type: illustration
narration: Energy is defined as the capacity or ability to do work. There are many forms of energy but two common types are kinetic and potential energy. Kinetic energy is the energy an object possesses due to its motion while potential energy is stored energy that has the potential to do work. Like work energy is also measured in Joules.
